preserve_details.notes: A prominent brown and white braided fringe trim lines the entire front opening and collar. This is a key textural and design element that must be preserved.

The garment is made of a multi-patterned fabric, likely a block print style. The integrity, color, and arrangement of the different patterns (geometric, floral, abstract) are essential to the garment's aesthetic.
The sleeves have wide, distinct cuffs formed by folding the fabric back. The structure and pattern continuity on the cuffs should be maintained.

construction_details.silhouette_rule: This is an open-front kimono-style jacket with no closures. The front panels should hang loosely and symmetrically.
The sleeves are wide and cut straight, contributing to the garment's boxy and relaxed fit. Their shape and volume should be preserved.
The collar is a continuous band that extends down the front opening. It should lay relatively flat against the body.

hollow_regions.edge_sampling_notes: The edge is defined by the textured fringe trim. Capture the detail of the braid and tassels.
hollow_regions.inner_description: The inner back of the garment is visible, showing a cream and blue geometric pattern.

hollow_regions.edge_sampling_notes: The sleeve opening edge is a clean, hemmed cuff. The pattern wraps around the edge.
hollow_regions.inner_description: The inside of the sleeve cuff is visible, showing the reverse side of the fabric.

special_handling: The garment has a very loose, unstructured, and flowy silhouette typical of a kimono or duster jacket. It is crucial to maintain this natural drape. The complex, multi-pattern print and the fringe trim are the most important visual features and must be preserved with high fidelity.
